isis.stitle: DT 466 / DT 570 / HT 570 Service Manual - 2004 Emissions with EGR - Air Compressor and Power Steering Pump - Installation

warning.para: To avoid serious personal injury, possible death, or damage to the engine or vehicle, do not attempt to install the air compressor alone. It is advised to have two people install the air compressor onto the engine.

step1.para:
On work bench, loosely install air compressor support bracket assembly
to the air compressor with two bolts (M10 x 25). Thread finger tight but do not tighten.
Apply a small amount of assembly grease to the O-ring and install into groove on front cover.

Install the air compressor and support bracket assembly
onto front cover with two bolts (M12 x 80). Tighten, but do not torque.
Loosely install two bolts (M12 x 25) through air compressor bracket into crankcase.
Torque all air compressor bolts in the following order:

caution.para: To avoid engine damage, do not over torque the air compressor mounting bolts. Over torquing bolts will result in a fractured front cover.

step2.para: Torque two compressor to front cover bolts (M12 x 80) to the standard torque value .
Torque two compressor to bracket assembly bolts (M12 x 25) to the special torque value .
Torque two bracket assembly to crankcase bolts (M12 x 10) to the special torque value .

step1.para: Uncap coolant hoses and install onto elbow assembly (M18) and connector assembly (M18) fittings with hose clamps.

note.para:
If these fittings were removed from the crankcase or air compressor for any reason, they will require standard torque values
and need to be oriented to the correct angle
upon installation.

step1.para: Remove caps and install oil supply hose to elbow assembly (M10). Tighten oil supply line fitting.
Install oil drain hose elbow and clamps.
